frameworks.name: HIPAA
frameworks.fullName: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act - Security Rule

frameworks.name: ISO 42001
frameworks.fullName: ISO/IEC 42001:2023 - Information Technology - Artificial Intelligence Management System

frameworks.name: NIS 2
frameworks.fullName: Network and Information Security Directive 2 (EU Directive 2022/2555)

frameworks.name: NIST AI RMF
frameworks.fullName: NIST Artificial Intelligence Risk Management Framework 1.0

frameworks.name: PCI DSS
frameworks.fullName: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard

objectives.name: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
objectives.description: Implementation of multi-factor authentication to verify user identity using two or more independent authentication factors.

controls.description: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events.
Secure authentication technologies and procedures shall be established and implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control.
Implement procedures to verify the identity of a person or entity seeking access to ePHI, including multi-factor authentication.
Ensure the ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of processing systems and services.

controls.controlName: Identify Users and Authenticate Access to System Components
controls.description: Assign unique user IDs. Implement MFA for all access to the CDE.
Implement ICT security policies, procedures, protocols and tools to ensure the resilience, continuity and availability of ICT systems.
Use of multi-factor authentication or continuous authentication, secured voice, video, and text communications.
Use multifactor authentication for local and network access to privileged accounts and for network access to non-privileged accounts.

objectives.name: Encryption at Rest
objectives.description: Encrypt sensitive data stored in databases, file systems, and storage services using strong cryptographic algorithms.

controls.description: The entity restricts the transmission, movement, and removal of information to authorized internal and external users and processes.
The entity identifies and maintains confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.

Data masking shall be used in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration.
Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, shall be defined and implemented.
Implement a mechanism to encrypt and decrypt ePHI stored in databases and storage systems.
Implement pseudonymization and encryption of personal data to minimize breach impact.
Protect stored account data using strong cryptography. PAN must be rendered unreadable anywhere it is stored.
Implement ICT security policies, procedures, protocols and tools to ensure the resilience, continuity and availability of ICT systems.
Implement policies and procedures regarding the use of cryptography and, where appropriate, encryption.
Employ FIPS-validated cryptography when used to protect the confidentiality of CUI.

objectives.name: Audit Logging and Monitoring
objectives.description: Implement comprehensive logging of security events, access to sensitive data, and administrative actions. Centralize and monitor logs.

controls.description: To meet its objectives, the entity uses detection and monitoring procedures to identify anomalies that are indicative of security events.
The entity monitors system components and the operation of those components for anomalies indicative of malicious acts, natural disasters, and errors.
Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant events shall be produced, stored, protected and analysed.
Implement hardware, software, and/or procedural mechanisms that record and examine activity in systems containing or using ePHI.
Implement a process for regularly testing, assessing and evaluating the effectiveness of technical and organizational measures.

controls.controlName: Log and Monitor All Access to System Components and Cardholder Data
controls.description: Implement extensive logging mechanisms to track and monitor all access.
Establish mechanisms to promptly detect anomalous activities, including ICT network performance issues and ICT-related incidents.
Implement policies and procedures to assess the effectiveness of cybersecurity risk management measures.
Create and retain system audit logs and records to the extent needed to enable monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting.
Ensure that the actions of individual system users can be uniquely traced to those users so they can be held accountable.
Mechanisms for tracking identified AI risks over time are in place.
Monitor AI system performance, accuracy, and impacts in production. Conduct regular reviews.

objectives.name: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
objectives.description: Implement role-based access control with least privilege to restrict system and data access to authorized personnel only.

controls.description: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events.
The entity authorizes, modifies, or removes access to data, software, functions, and other protected information assets based on roles, responsibilities, or the system design.
Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.
The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and managed.
Access to information and other associated assets shall be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.
Implement procedures for the authorization and/or supervision of workforce members who work with ePHI.
Ensure the ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of processing systems and services.

controls.controlName: Restrict Access to System Components and Cardholder Data by Business Need to Know
controls.description: Restrict access strictly by business need-to-know principles.
Implement ICT security policies, procedures, protocols and tools to ensure the resilience, continuity and availability of ICT systems.

controls.controlName: Human Resources Security and Access Control
controls.description: Implement human resources security, access control policies, and asset management.
Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices.
Limit information system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.
Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts.

objectives.name: Incident Response and Breach Notification
objectives.description: Establish incident response plan, breach notification procedures, and post-incident review processes.

controls.description: The entity evaluates identified security events to determine whether controls have been compromised and whether incident response is required.
The entity responds to identified security incidents by executing a defined incident response program to understand, contain, remediate, and communicate security incidents.
The entity identifies, develops, and implements activities to recover from identified security incidents.

controls.controlName: Information Security Incident Management Planning and Preparation
controls.description: The organization shall plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating information security incident management processes, roles and responsibilities.
Implement policies and procedures to address security incidents. Identify and respond to suspected or known security incidents.
In case of a personal data breach, the controller shall notify the competent supervisory authority within 72 hours of becoming aware of it.
When the personal data breach is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall communicate the breach to the data subject without undue delay.

controls.controlName: Support Information Security with Organizational Policies and Programs
controls.description: Create, maintain, and disseminate a comprehensive organizational information security policy reviewed annually.
Establish and implement an ICT-related incident management process to detect, manage, and notify ICT-related incidents.
Report major ICT-related incidents to the relevant competent authority. Initial notification within 4 hours of classification.
Implement procedures for incident handling, including detection, response, analysis, and reporting.
Submit an early warning to the CSIRT or competent authority within 24 hours of becoming aware of a significant incident.
Submit a detailed incident notification within 72 hours of becoming aware of a significant incident.
Submit a final report within one month of the incident notification, including root cause analysis and mitigation measures.
AI risks based on assessments are prioritized, responded to, and managed.
React to nonconformities, evaluate causes, and take corrective action to prevent recurrence.

objectives.name: Data Masking and Pseudonymization
objectives.description: Implement data masking, tokenization, and pseudonymization to minimize the exposure of sensitive data.

controls.description: The entity identifies and maintains confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.
The entity disposes of confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.

Data masking shall be used in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration.
Implement a mechanism to encrypt and decrypt ePHI stored in databases and storage systems.
Implement pseudonymization and encryption of personal data to minimize breach impact.
Protect stored account data using strong cryptography. PAN must be rendered unreadable anywhere it is stored.
Implement policies and procedures regarding the use of cryptography and, where appropriate, encryption.
Employ FIPS-validated cryptography when used to protect the confidentiality of CUI.
Ensure data used for AI systems is appropriate, of sufficient quality, and managed responsibly throughout the AI lifecycle.

objectives.name: Session Management and Timeout
objectives.description: Implement session timeout controls to automatically terminate inactive sessions and require re-authentication.

controls.description: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events.
Information stored on, processed by or accessible via user endpoint devices shall be protected.
Implement electronic procedures that terminate sessions after a predetermined period of inactivity.
Ensure the ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of processing systems and services.

controls.controlName: Identify Users and Authenticate Access to System Components
controls.description: Assign unique user IDs. Implement MFA for all access to the CDE.
Implement ICT security policies, procedures, protocols and tools to ensure the resilience, continuity and availability of ICT systems.

controls.controlName: Human Resources Security and Access Control
controls.description: Implement human resources security, access control policies, and asset management.
Monitor and control remote access sessions.

objectives.name: Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery
objectives.description: Implement business continuity and disaster recovery plans with defined RTO/RPO, backup procedures, and regular testing.

controls.description: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, implements, operates, approves, maintains, and monitors environmental protections to meet availability commitments.
The entity tests recovery plan procedures supporting system recovery to meet its objectives.
The organization shall plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.
Establish and implement policies and procedures for responding to an emergency or other occurrence that damages systems containing ePHI.
Implement ability to restore the availability and access to personal data in a timely manner in the event of a physical or technical incident.
Put in place a comprehensive ICT business continuity policy with response and recovery strategies.
Implement backup policies and restoration procedures ensuring data can be restored with minimum downtime.
Ensure business continuity and crisis management, including backup management, disaster recovery, and crisis management.

objectives.name: Consent Management and Data Subject Rights
objectives.description: Implement mechanisms for obtaining, tracking, and managing user consent and fulfilling data subject rights requests.

controls.description: The entity provides notice to data subjects about its privacy practices and obtains consent, where required.
The entity implements a process for data subjects to request access to, modification of, or deletion of their personal information.
Personal data shall be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject.
Data subjects have the right to obtain confirmation of processing and access to their personal data.
Data subjects have the right to have inaccurate personal data rectified.

controls.controlName: Right to Erasure (Right to be Forgotten)
controls.description: Data subjects have the right to have their personal data erased under certain conditions.
Data subjects have the right to receive their personal data in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format.
Ensure data used for AI systems is appropriate, of sufficient quality, and managed responsibly throughout the AI lifecycle.

objectives.name: Vulnerability Management and Penetration Testing
objectives.description: Implement vulnerability scanning, patch management, and penetration testing programs.

controls.description: The entity selects, develops, and performs ongoing and/or separate evaluations to ascertain whether the components of internal control are present and functioning.

Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use shall be obtained, the organization's exposure to such vulnerabilities shall be evaluated and appropriate measures shall be taken.
Conduct an accurate and thorough assessment of the potential risks and vulnerabilities to the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of ePHI.
Implement a process for regularly testing, assessing and evaluating the effectiveness of technical and organizational measures.

controls.controlName: Test Security of Systems and Networks Regularly
controls.description: Test security through quarterly vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and wireless access point monitoring.
Establish, maintain, and review a digital operational resilience testing programme.

controls.controlName: Testing of ICT Tools and Systems
controls.description: Perform testing including vulnerability assessments, open source analyses, network security assessments, source code reviews.
Significant financial entities shall carry out advanced Threat-Led Penetration Testing at least every 3 years.

controls.controlName: Security in Network and Information Systems Acquisition
controls.description: Ensure security in network and information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance, including vulnerability handling and disclosure.
Implement policies and procedures to assess the effectiveness of cybersecurity risk management measures.
Appropriate methods and metrics are identified and applied to assess and monitor AI risks.
Conduct internal audits of the AIMS at planned intervals to ensure conformity and effectiveness.

objectives.name: Security Awareness Training
objectives.description: Implement security awareness training programs for all employees, with specialized training for technical roles and management.

controls.description: The entity internally communicates information, including objectives and responsibilities for internal control, necessary to support the functioning of internal control.

controls.controlName: Information Security Awareness, Education and Training
controls.description: Personnel of the organization and relevant interested parties shall receive appropriate information security awareness education and training.
Implement a security awareness and training program for all workforce members.

controls.controlName: Support Information Security with Organizational Policies and Programs
controls.description: Create, maintain, and disseminate a comprehensive organizational information security policy reviewed annually.

controls.controlName: Basic Cyber Hygiene and Cybersecurity Training
controls.description: Implement basic cyber hygiene practices and provide cybersecurity training.
Organizational practices are in place to foster a critical thinking mindset by personnel working with AI systems.
Ensure persons involved in AI system development and operation are competent and aware of their responsibilities.

objectives.name: Third-Party/Vendor Risk Management
objectives.description: Assess, manage, and monitor risks from third-party vendors, service providers, and supply chain partners.

controls.description: The entity assesses and manages risks associated with vendors and business partners.
Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the use of supplier's products or services.
Document satisfactory assurances from business associates that they will appropriately safeguard ePHI through Business Associate Agreements.
Processing by a processor shall be governed by a contract or legal act that sets out the subject-matter, duration, nature, and purpose of the processing.
Transfers of personal data to third countries shall only take place if appropriate safeguards are provided.

controls.controlName: General Principles for ICT Third-Party Risk
controls.description: Manage ICT third-party risk as an integral part of ICT risk. Maintain a register of all ICT third-party arrangements.
Contractual arrangements for ICT services shall include specific provisions covering SLAs, data location, audit rights, and exit strategies.
Assess and manage concentration risk arising from dependence on specific ICT third-party providers.
Ensure supply chain security including security-related aspects between each entity and its direct suppliers or service providers.

controls.controlName: Policies Addressing AI Risks in Third-Party Systems
controls.description: Policies and procedures are in place to address AI risks from third-party entities, including value chain and supply chain.
Assess and manage risks from third-party AI components, including pre-trained models, APIs, and data sources.
Ensure agreements with AI service providers address AI-specific risks, responsibilities, and requirements.

cmmc/AC.L2-3.1.1.description: Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices.

cmmc/AC.L2-3.1.2.description: Limit information system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.

cmmc/AC.L2-3.1.5.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts.

cmmc/AC.L2-3.1.7.description: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions and audit the execution of such functions.

cmmc/AC.L2-3.1.12.description: Monitor and control remote access sessions.

cmmc/IA.L2-3.5.1.description: Identify information system users, processes acting on behalf of users, or devices.

cmmc/IA.L2-3.5.3.description: Use multifactor authentication for local and network access to privileged accounts and for network access to non-privileged accounts.

cmmc/IA.L2-3.5.7.description: Enforce a minimum password complexity and change of characters when new passwords are created.

cmmc/IA.L2-3.5.10.description: Store and transmit only cryptographically-protected passwords.

cmmc/AU.L2-3.3.1.description: Create and retain system audit logs and records to the extent needed to enable monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting.

cmmc/AU.L2-3.3.2.description: Ensure that the actions of individual system users can be uniquely traced to those users so they can be held accountable.

cmmc/AU.L2-3.3.4.description: Alert in the event of an audit logging process failure.

cmmc/AU.L2-3.3.8.description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

cmmc/SC.L2-3.13.1.description: Monitor, control, and protect organizational communications at external and key internal boundaries.

cmmc/SC.L2-3.13.8.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission.

cmmc/SC.L2-3.13.11.description: Employ FIPS-validated cryptography when used to protect the confidentiality of CUI.

dora/DORA-5.description: Establish and maintain a sound, comprehensive, and well-documented ICT risk management framework as part of the overall risk management system.

dora/DORA-6.description: Identify, classify, and adequately document all ICT-supported business functions, information assets, and ICT assets.

dora/DORA-7.description: Implement ICT security policies, procedures, protocols and tools to ensure the resilience, continuity and availability of ICT systems.

dora/DORA-8.description: Establish mechanisms to promptly detect anomalous activities, including ICT network performance issues and ICT-related incidents.

dora/DORA-9.description: Put in place a comprehensive ICT business continuity policy with response and recovery strategies.

dora/DORA-10.description: Implement backup policies and restoration procedures ensuring data can be restored with minimum downtime.

dora/DORA-11.description: Gather knowledge from ICT incidents and share lessons learned to improve the risk management framework.

dora/DORA-12.description: Implement communication plans for responsible disclosure of ICT incidents and vulnerabilities.

dora/DORA-17.description: Establish and implement an ICT-related incident management process to detect, manage, and notify ICT-related incidents.

dora/DORA-18.description: Classify ICT incidents based on defined criteria including impact, duration, geographic spread, and criticality of affected services.

dora/DORA-19.description: Report major ICT-related incidents to the relevant competent authority. Initial notification within 4 hours of classification.

dora/DORA-20.controlName: Voluntary Notification of Significant Cyber Threats
dora/DORA-20.description: Financial entities may voluntarily notify competent authorities of significant cyber threats they deem relevant.

dora/DORA-24.description: Establish, maintain, and review a digital operational resilience testing programme.

dora/DORA-25.controlName: Testing of ICT Tools and Systems
dora/DORA-25.description: Perform testing including vulnerability assessments, open source analyses, network security assessments, source code reviews.

dora/DORA-26.description: Significant financial entities shall carry out advanced Threat-Led Penetration Testing at least every 3 years.

dora/DORA-28.controlName: General Principles for ICT Third-Party Risk
dora/DORA-28.description: Manage ICT third-party risk as an integral part of ICT risk. Maintain a register of all ICT third-party arrangements.

dora/DORA-30.description: Contractual arrangements for ICT services shall include specific provisions covering SLAs, data location, audit rights, and exit strategies.

dora/DORA-31.description: Assess and manage concentration risk arising from dependence on specific ICT third-party providers.

dora/DORA-33.description: Critical ICT third-party providers are subject to direct oversight by the Lead Overseer designated by the ESAs.

dora/DORA-45.description: Financial entities may exchange cyber threat information and intelligence, including indicators of compromise.

gdpr/GDPR-5.1a.description: Personal data shall be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject.

gdpr/GDPR-5.1b.description: Data shall be collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not further processed in a manner incompatible with those purposes.

gdpr/GDPR-5.1c.description: Data shall be adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed.

gdpr/GDPR-5.1d.description: Data shall be accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date.

gdpr/GDPR-5.1e.description: Data shall be kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary.

gdpr/GDPR-5.1f.description: Data shall be processed with appropriate security measures, including protection against unauthorized or unlawful processing and against accidental loss.

gdpr/GDPR-5.2.description: The controller shall be responsible for and able to demonstrate compliance with the data processing principles.

gdpr/GDPR-15.description: Data subjects have the right to obtain confirmation of processing and access to their personal data.

gdpr/GDPR-16.description: Data subjects have the right to have inaccurate personal data rectified.

gdpr/GDPR-17.controlName: Right to Erasure (Right to be Forgotten)
gdpr/GDPR-17.description: Data subjects have the right to have their personal data erased under certain conditions.

gdpr/GDPR-20.description: Data subjects have the right to receive their personal data in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format.

gdpr/GDPR-32a.description: Implement pseudonymization and encryption of personal data to minimize breach impact.

gdpr/GDPR-32b.description: Ensure the ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of processing systems and services.

gdpr/GDPR-32c.description: Implement ability to restore the availability and access to personal data in a timely manner in the event of a physical or technical incident.

gdpr/GDPR-32d.description: Implement a process for regularly testing, assessing and evaluating the effectiveness of technical and organizational measures.

gdpr/GDPR-32e.description: Deploy advanced antivirus, antimalware, and real-time threat detection tools.

gdpr/GDPR-33.description: In case of a personal data breach, the controller shall notify the competent supervisory authority within 72 hours of becoming aware of it.

gdpr/GDPR-34.description: When the personal data breach is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall communicate the breach to the data subject without undue delay.

gdpr/GDPR-44.description: Transfers of personal data to third countries shall only take place if appropriate safeguards are provided.

gdpr/GDPR-28.description: Processing by a processor shall be governed by a contract or legal act that sets out the subject-matter, duration, nature, and purpose of the processing.

hipaa/TS-AC-1.description: Assign a unique name and/or number for identifying and tracking user identity.

hipaa/TS-AC-2.description: Establish and implement highly privileged, audited procedures for obtaining access to ePHI during an emergency.

hipaa/TS-AC-3.description: Implement electronic procedures that terminate sessions after a predetermined period of inactivity.

hipaa/TS-AC-4.description: Implement a mechanism to encrypt and decrypt ePHI stored in databases and storage systems.

hipaa/TS-AU-1.description: Implement hardware, software, and/or procedural mechanisms that record and examine activity in systems containing or using ePHI.

hipaa/TS-IN-1.description: Implement electronic mechanisms to corroborate that ePHI has not been altered or destroyed in an unauthorized manner.

hipaa/TS-PE-1.description: Implement procedures to verify the identity of a person or entity seeking access to ePHI, including multi-factor authentication.

hipaa/TS-TX-1.description: Implement security measures to ensure that electronically transmitted ePHI is not improperly modified without detection.

hipaa/TS-TX-2.description: Implement a mechanism to encrypt ePHI whenever it is transmitted over electronic communications networks, especially public networks.

hipaa/AS-RM-1.description: Conduct an accurate and thorough assessment of the potential risks and vulnerabilities to the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of ePHI.

hipaa/AS-RM-2.description: Implement security measures sufficient to reduce risks and vulnerabilities to a reasonable and appropriate level.

hipaa/AS-WS-1.description: Implement procedures for the authorization and/or supervision of workforce members who work with ePHI.

hipaa/AS-SA-1.description: Implement a security awareness and training program for all workforce members.

hipaa/AS-IR-1.description: Implement policies and procedures to address security incidents. Identify and respond to suspected or known security incidents.

hipaa/AS-CP-1.description: Establish and implement policies and procedures for responding to an emergency or other occurrence that damages systems containing ePHI.

hipaa/AS-BA-1.description: Document satisfactory assurances from business associates that they will appropriately safeguard ePHI through Business Associate Agreements.

iso27001/A.5.1.description: Information security policy and topic-specific policies shall be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

iso27001/A.5.2.description: Information security roles and responsibilities shall be defined and allocated.

iso27001/A.5.3.description: Conflicting duties and conflicting areas of responsibility shall be segregated.

iso27001/A.5.7.description: Information relating to information security threats shall be collected and analysed to produce threat intelligence.

iso27001/A.5.8.description: Information security shall be integrated into project management.

iso27001/A.5.12.description: Information shall be classified according to the information security needs of the organization based on confidentiality, integrity, availability and relevant interested party requirements.

iso27001/A.5.15.description: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.

iso27001/A.5.19.description: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the use of supplier's products or services.

iso27001/A.5.24.controlName: Information Security Incident Management Planning and Preparation
iso27001/A.5.24.description: The organization shall plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating information security incident management processes, roles and responsibilities.

iso27001/A.5.29.description: The organization shall plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.

iso27001/A.6.1.description: Background verification checks on all candidates to become personnel shall be carried out prior to joining the organization and on an ongoing basis.

iso27001/A.6.2.description: Employment contractual agreements shall state the personnel's and the organization's responsibilities for information security.

iso27001/A.6.3.controlName: Information Security Awareness, Education and Training
iso27001/A.6.3.description: Personnel of the organization and relevant interested parties shall receive appropriate information security awareness education and training.

iso27001/A.6.4.description: A disciplinary process shall be formalized and communicated to take actions against personnel who have committed an information security policy violation.

iso27001/A.6.5.controlName: Responsibilities After Termination or Change of Employment
iso27001/A.6.5.description: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment shall be defined, enforced and communicated.

iso27001/A.6.8.description: The organization shall provide a mechanism for personnel to report observed or suspected information security events through appropriate channels in a timely manner.

iso27001/A.7.1.description: Security perimeters shall be defined and used to protect areas that contain information and other associated assets.

iso27001/A.7.4.description: Premises shall be continuously monitored for unauthorized physical access.

iso27001/A.7.10.description: Storage media shall be managed through their life cycle of acquisition, use, transportation and disposal in accordance with the organization's classification scheme.

iso27001/A.8.1.description: Information stored on, processed by or accessible via user endpoint devices shall be protected.

iso27001/A.8.2.description: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and managed.

iso27001/A.8.3.description: Access to information and other associated assets shall be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.

iso27001/A.8.5.description: Secure authentication technologies and procedures shall be established and implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control.

iso27001/A.8.7.description: Protection against malware shall be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.

iso27001/A.8.8.description: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use shall be obtained, the organization's exposure to such vulnerabilities shall be evaluated and appropriate measures shall be taken.

iso27001/A.8.9.description: Configurations, including security configurations, of hardware, software, services and networks shall be established, documented, implemented, monitored and reviewed.

iso27001/A.8.11.description: Data masking shall be used in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration.

iso27001/A.8.15.description: Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant events shall be produced, stored, protected and analysed.

iso27001/A.8.20.description: Networks and network devices shall be secured, managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.

iso27001/A.8.24.description: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, shall be defined and implemented.

iso27001/A.8.25.description: Rules for the secure development of software and systems shall be established and applied.

iso27001/A.8.28.description: Secure coding principles shall be applied to software development.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.2.1.description: Establish an AI policy that includes commitment to responsible AI development and use.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.2.2.description: Define measurable objectives for the AI policy and plan to achieve them.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.3.1.description: Establish roles, responsibilities, and authorities for AI management system.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.3.2.description: Top management shall demonstrate leadership and commitment to the AI management system.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.4.1.description: Determine and provide resources needed for the establishment, implementation, maintenance, and continual improvement of the AIMS.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.4.2.description: Ensure persons involved in AI system development and operation are competent and aware of their responsibilities.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.5.1.description: Assess the potential impacts of AI systems on individuals, groups, and society before deployment.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.5.2.description: Conduct risk assessment specific to AI systems, considering AI-unique risks like bias, hallucination, and unintended behaviors.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.6.1.description: Plan and design AI systems with responsible AI principles integrated from the beginning.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.6.2.description: Ensure data used for AI systems is appropriate, of sufficient quality, and managed responsibly throughout the AI lifecycle.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.6.3.description: Develop and verify AI models using appropriate techniques, ensuring they perform as intended.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.7.1.description: Document AI systems sufficiently to enable appropriate understanding, use, and oversight.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.7.2.description: Ensure AI system outputs and decisions can be understood by stakeholders to the degree necessary.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.7.3.description: Identify and mitigate bias in AI systems to ensure fair outcomes across different groups.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.8.1.description: Deploy AI systems with appropriate controls, monitoring, and rollback capabilities.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.8.2.description: Monitor AI system performance, accuracy, and impacts in production. Conduct regular reviews.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.9.1.description: Conduct internal audits of the AIMS at planned intervals to ensure conformity and effectiveness.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.9.2.description: Top management shall review the AI management system at planned intervals to ensure its continuing suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.10.1.description: React to nonconformities, evaluate causes, and take corrective action to prevent recurrence.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.10.2.description: Continually improve the suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness of the AI management system.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.10.3.description: Assess and manage risks from third-party AI components, including pre-trained models, APIs, and data sources.

iso42001/ISO42001-A.10.4.description: Ensure agreements with AI service providers address AI-specific risks, responsibilities, and requirements.

nis2/NIS2-21.2a.controlName: Risk Analysis and Information System Security Policies
nis2/NIS2-21.2a.description: Implement policies on risk analysis and information system security.

nis2/NIS2-21.2b.description: Implement procedures for incident handling, including detection, response, analysis, and reporting.

nis2/NIS2-21.2c.description: Ensure business continuity and crisis management, including backup management, disaster recovery, and crisis management.

nis2/NIS2-21.2d.description: Ensure supply chain security including security-related aspects between each entity and its direct suppliers or service providers.

nis2/NIS2-21.2e.controlName: Security in Network and Information Systems Acquisition
nis2/NIS2-21.2e.description: Ensure security in network and information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance, including vulnerability handling and disclosure.

nis2/NIS2-21.2f.description: Implement policies and procedures to assess the effectiveness of cybersecurity risk management measures.

nis2/NIS2-21.2g.controlName: Basic Cyber Hygiene and Cybersecurity Training
nis2/NIS2-21.2g.description: Implement basic cyber hygiene practices and provide cybersecurity training.

nis2/NIS2-21.2h.description: Implement policies and procedures regarding the use of cryptography and, where appropriate, encryption.

nis2/NIS2-21.2i.controlName: Human Resources Security and Access Control
nis2/NIS2-21.2i.description: Implement human resources security, access control policies, and asset management.

nis2/NIS2-21.2j.description: Use of multi-factor authentication or continuous authentication, secured voice, video, and text communications.

nis2/NIS2-23.1.description: Submit an early warning to the CSIRT or competent authority within 24 hours of becoming aware of a significant incident.

nis2/NIS2-23.2.description: Submit a detailed incident notification within 72 hours of becoming aware of a significant incident.

nis2/NIS2-23.3.description: Submit a final report within one month of the incident notification, including root cause analysis and mitigation measures.

nis2/NIS2-20.1.description: Management bodies shall approve and oversee the implementation of cybersecurity risk management measures.

nis2/NIS2-20.2.description: Members of the management body shall follow cybersecurity training to gain sufficient knowledge and skills.

nist-ai-rmf/GOV-1.description: Policies, processes, procedures, and practices across the organization related to the mapping, measuring, and managing of AI risks are in place, transparent, and implemented effectively.

nist-ai-rmf/GOV-2.description: Organizational AI risk tolerance is determined and clearly communicated.

nist-ai-rmf/GOV-3.description: Workforce diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility processes are prioritized in the mapping, measuring, and managing of AI risks.

nist-ai-rmf/GOV-4.description: Organizational practices are in place to foster a critical thinking mindset by personnel working with AI systems.

nist-ai-rmf/GOV-5.description: Processes are in place for robust engagement with relevant AI actors.

nist-ai-rmf/GOV-6.controlName: Policies Addressing AI Risks in Third-Party Systems
nist-ai-rmf/GOV-6.description: Policies and procedures are in place to address AI risks from third-party entities, including value chain and supply chain.

nist-ai-rmf/MAP-1.description: Context is established and understood for the AI system's intended purpose, deployment setting, and users.

nist-ai-rmf/MAP-2.description: Categorization of the AI system is performed to inform risk identification and management.

nist-ai-rmf/MAP-3.description: Benefits and costs of AI system deployment are assessed, including societal impact considerations.

nist-ai-rmf/MAP-4.controlName: Risks and Impacts of AI System
nist-ai-rmf/MAP-4.description: Risks and potential impacts are identified based on the AI system's context, known limitations, and deployment environment.

nist-ai-rmf/MAP-5.description: Risk likelihood and magnitude are assessed for identified AI risks, stakeholders, and communities.

nist-ai-rmf/MEA-1.description: Appropriate methods and metrics are identified and applied to assess and monitor AI risks.

nist-ai-rmf/MEA-2.description: AI system trustworthiness characteristics (validity, reliability, fairness, safety, security, privacy, explainability) are evaluated.

nist-ai-rmf/MEA-3.description: Mechanisms for tracking identified AI risks over time are in place.

nist-ai-rmf/MEA-4.description: Feedback about efficacy of measurement approaches is collected and AI system performance is assessed.

nist-ai-rmf/MAN-1.description: AI risks based on assessments are prioritized, responded to, and managed.

nist-ai-rmf/MAN-2.description: Plans for minimizing, monitoring, and managing AI system risks are implemented and inform system operation and updates.

nist-ai-rmf/MAN-3.description: AI risks and benefits from third-party resources are regularly monitored, and appropriate actions are taken.

nist-ai-rmf/MAN-4.description: Risks and benefits are routinely assessed. AI system decommissioning is handled in a responsible manner.

pci-dss/PCI-1.domain: Build and Maintain a Secure Network and Systems
pci-dss/PCI-1.controlName: Install and Maintain Network Security Controls
pci-dss/PCI-1.description: Install and maintain network security controls to restrict traffic to and from the Cardholder Data Environment (CDE).

pci-dss/PCI-2.domain: Build and Maintain a Secure Network and Systems
pci-dss/PCI-2.controlName: Apply Secure Configurations to All System Components
pci-dss/PCI-2.description: Eliminate vendor-supplied defaults and apply secure baseline configurations to all system components.

pci-dss/PCI-3.description: Protect stored account data using strong cryptography. PAN must be rendered unreadable anywhere it is stored.

pci-dss/PCI-4.controlName: Protect Cardholder Data with Strong Cryptography During Transmission
pci-dss/PCI-4.description: Protect cardholder data with strong cryptography when transmitted over open, public networks.

pci-dss/PCI-5.controlName: Protect All Systems and Networks from Malicious Software
pci-dss/PCI-5.description: Deploy, maintain, and regularly update anti-malware software across all systems commonly affected.

pci-dss/PCI-6.controlName: Develop and Maintain Secure Systems and Software
pci-dss/PCI-6.description: Develop secure software by integrating security into the SDLC. Apply critical patches promptly.

pci-dss/PCI-7.controlName: Restrict Access to System Components and Cardholder Data by Business Need to Know
pci-dss/PCI-7.description: Restrict access strictly by business need-to-know principles.

pci-dss/PCI-8.controlName: Identify Users and Authenticate Access to System Components
pci-dss/PCI-8.description: Assign unique user IDs. Implement MFA for all access to the CDE.

pci-dss/PCI-9.controlName: Restrict Physical Access to Cardholder Data
pci-dss/PCI-9.description: Restrict, log, and monitor physical access to facilities containing cardholder data environments.

pci-dss/PCI-10.controlName: Log and Monitor All Access to System Components and Cardholder Data
pci-dss/PCI-10.description: Implement extensive logging mechanisms to track and monitor all access.

pci-dss/PCI-11.controlName: Test Security of Systems and Networks Regularly
pci-dss/PCI-11.description: Test security through quarterly vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and wireless access point monitoring.

pci-dss/PCI-12.controlName: Support Information Security with Organizational Policies and Programs
pci-dss/PCI-12.description: Create, maintain, and disseminate a comprehensive organizational information security policy reviewed annually.

soc2/CC1.1.controlName: COSO Principle 1: Integrity and Ethical Values
soc2/CC1.1.description: The entity demonstrates a commitment to integrity and ethical values through the development of a code of conduct, communication of expected standards, and enforcement of compliance.

soc2/CC1.2.description: The board of directors demonstrates independence from management and exercises oversight of the development and performance of internal controls.

soc2/CC1.3.description: Management establishes, with board oversight, structures, reporting lines, and appropriate authorities and responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.

soc2/CC1.4.description: The entity demonstrates a commitment to attract, develop, and retain competent individuals in alignment with objectives.

soc2/CC1.5.description: The entity holds individuals accountable for their internal control responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.

soc2/CC2.1.description: The entity obtains or generates and uses relevant, quality information to support the functioning of internal controls.

soc2/CC2.2.description: The entity internally communicates information, including objectives and responsibilities for internal control, necessary to support the functioning of internal control.

soc2/CC2.3.description: The entity communicates with external parties regarding matters affecting the functioning of internal control.

soc2/CC3.1.description: The entity specifies objectives with sufficient clarity to enable the identification and assessment of risks relating to objectives.

soc2/CC3.2.description: The entity identifies risks to the achievement of its objectives across the entity and analyzes risks as a basis for determining how the risks should be managed.

soc2/CC3.3.description: The entity considers the potential for fraud in assessing risks to the achievement of objectives.

soc2/CC3.4.description: The entity identifies and assesses changes that could significantly impact the system of internal control.

soc2/CC4.1.description: The entity selects, develops, and performs ongoing and/or separate evaluations to ascertain whether the components of internal control are present and functioning.

soc2/CC4.2.description: The entity evaluates and communicates internal control deficiencies in a timely manner to those parties responsible for taking corrective action.

soc2/CC5.1.description: The entity selects and develops control activities that contribute to the mitigation of risks to the achievement of objectives to acceptable levels.

soc2/CC5.2.description: The entity also selects and develops general control activities over technology to support the achievement of objectives.

soc2/CC5.3.description: The entity deploys control activities through policies that establish what is expected and procedures that put policies into action.

soc2/CC6.1.description: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events.

soc2/CC6.2.description: Prior to issuing system credentials and granting system access, the entity registers and authorizes new users whose access is restricted to authorized personnel.

soc2/CC6.3.description: The entity authorizes, modifies, or removes access to data, software, functions, and other protected information assets based on roles, responsibilities, or the system design.

soc2/CC6.6.description: The entity implements logical access security measures to protect against threats from sources outside its system boundaries.

soc2/CC6.7.description: The entity restricts the transmission, movement, and removal of information to authorized internal and external users and processes.

soc2/CC6.8.description: The entity implements controls to prevent or detect and act upon the introduction of unauthorized or malicious software.

soc2/CC7.1.description: To meet its objectives, the entity uses detection and monitoring procedures to identify anomalies that are indicative of security events.

soc2/CC7.2.description: The entity monitors system components and the operation of those components for anomalies indicative of malicious acts, natural disasters, and errors.

soc2/CC7.3.description: The entity evaluates identified security events to determine whether controls have been compromised and whether incident response is required.

soc2/CC7.4.description: The entity responds to identified security incidents by executing a defined incident response program to understand, contain, remediate, and communicate security incidents.

soc2/CC7.5.description: The entity identifies, develops, and implements activities to recover from identified security incidents.

soc2/CC8.1.description: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, configures, documents, tests, approves, and implements changes to infrastructure, data, software, and procedures.

soc2/CC9.1.description: The entity identifies, selects, and develops risk mitigation activities for risks arising from potential business disruptions.

soc2/CC9.2.description: The entity assesses and manages risks associated with vendors and business partners.

soc2/A1.1.description: The entity maintains, monitors, and evaluates current processing capacity and use of system components to manage capacity demand.

soc2/A1.2.description: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, implements, operates, approves, maintains, and monitors environmental protections to meet availability commitments.

soc2/A1.3.description: The entity tests recovery plan procedures supporting system recovery to meet its objectives.

soc2/PI1.1.description: The entity implements policies and procedures over system processing to ensure processing is complete, valid, accurate, timely, and authorized.

soc2/PI1.2.description: The entity implements policies and procedures to detect processing errors and take corrective action to ensure data integrity.

soc2/PI1.3.description: The entity implements policies and procedures over system inputs to ensure inputs are processed completely and accurately and outputs are distributed only to intended recipients.

soc2/C1.1.description: The entity identifies and maintains confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.

soc2/C1.2.description: The entity disposes of confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.

soc2/P1.1.description: The entity provides notice to data subjects about its privacy practices and obtains consent, where required.

soc2/P4.1.description: The entity implements a process for data subjects to request access to, modification of, or deletion of their personal information.

soc2/P6.1.description: The entity collects only the personal information necessary and maintains the quality of personal data.
